meanings.definition: To engage in a physical fight or struggle.
meanings.sent1: The two boys decided to buttle over a toy.
meanings.sent2: The knights would often buttle in the arena for honor.
meanings.sent3: I saw the squirrels buttle over the last acorn in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The waves and the rocks seemed to buttle endlessly along the shore.
meanings.sent5: The buttle between the cat and the dog was fierce and loud.

meanings.definition: To work as a servant or menial worker.
meanings.sent1: She would buttle in the kitchen, preparing meals for the family.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, many people would buttle in grand houses.
meanings.sent3: The robot butled efficiently, serving drinks to the guests.
meanings.sent4: The ants would buttle tirelessly, carrying food to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The buttle of the maid in the manor was never-ending.

meanings.definition: To engage in a heated argument or dispute.
meanings.sent1: The siblings would often buttle about who gets to use the TV first.
meanings.sent2: The politicians would buttle in the parliament over new laws.
meanings.sent3: The birds seemed to buttle loudly over the best spot on the tree.
meanings.sent4: The thunder and lightning buttled in the stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors would buttle noisily over the property line.
